intro: Omphalogonus nigritanus, commonly known as the black-eyed violets, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive violet flowers with a dark center. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in clay soils and its resistance to certain pests.
